Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, fabric is black in section, interior spotted with traces of a black resinous substance, with remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, worn in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.172)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36386) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36386)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 243 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13432 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
